summary: We are been labeled as bad guys and worst fans, just because we love Sansa. Yet, I never saw any posts from Sansa fans that...
question: We are been labeled as bad guys and worst fans, just because we love Sansa. Yet, I never saw any posts from Sansa fans that slander Got actors as sleeping with directors to get their Got roles. They slander Sophie, who was 13 year old child when she got casted from her school audition by Nina Gold as sleeping with directors to get her Got role. I never realized how crazy and intense the hatred that Sophie get for playing Sansa, until I read that post. But of course, we are the one who are vile.
answer: We are nowhere near as bad as other fanbases but because we support Sansa and have unpopular opinions about the show and books, they work hard to try and make us look bad. I mean how many of them said anything about the Jonsa hack or the horrible things people say about Sophie? Very few of them. Meanwhile we’re making multiple posts because one person stole fanart.

reblog.comment: We are nowhere near as bad as other fanbases but because we support Sansa and have unpopular opinions about the show and books, they work hard to try and make us look bad. I mean how many of them said anything about the Jonsa hack or the horrible things people say about Sophie? Very few of them. Meanwhile we’re making multiple posts because one person stole fanart.

blog.title: Did I come to the right place?

summary: Why is a certain group of the fandom so obsessed with Daenerys? Even when they’re talking about Sansa, they some how find a way...
body:
Why is a certain group of the fandom so obsessed with Daenerys? Even when they’re talking about Sansa, they some how find a way to be petty and throw hateful jabs towards dany. So far I haven’t seen a single Dany fan say anything bad about Sansa but I’ve seen countless of her fans foam at the mouth to hate on Dany. Seriously why are y’all so bitter? It’s so ugly the way you guys act.

Anyways I can’t wait for BFF’s Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen and Sansa Stark of Winterfell to meet and braid each other’s hair!

tags: or maybe the daensas are right and they're going to scissor
summary: Sansa's ascot looks sooo like D*ny's.
question: Sansa's ascot looks sooo like D*ny's.
answer:
We know she’s not wearing it when she first meets Dany. 

Yet she’s wearing in her last shot. The EW article of the season says that Sansa openly dislikes Dany at first. We know Sansa is going to play the game this season so why not make Dany believe they’re going to be allies/sisters? You attract more flies with honey than vinegar. Plus ascot is in Tully blue and it probably goes with a new outfit.

summary: Who do you think is with Cersei in the KL throne room? People think that it's the leader of the GC and Sansa, confirming kidnap...
question: Who do you think is with Cersei in the KL throne room? People think that it's the leader of the GC and Sansa, confirming kidnap plot, but it's hard to tell because it's dark and pixelized. While I think the kidnap plot/Cersei vs Sansa confrontation is going to happen, it might be a bit too early for Sansa to be in KL in this trailer and from what I can tell, the person on the right looks a bit too relaxed to be kidnapped. I'd love to be wrong tho and Sansa came willingly to protect her family.
answer:
Good question!

I agree that it all looks too casual and if that person on the right were Sansa, I think she would’ve stood in front of the throne. Regardless of whether she was kidnapped or came on her own free will.

So, I’m actually putting my money on Euron. Idk, but it looks like his stance? He’s relaxed, stands with his feet apart, and he has a long black coat that brushes the ground. I think this might be him and the leader of the GC. Euron has naturally stepped aside, as he was the one delivering the GC, to let Cersei talk to the leader (Harry Strickland?) about why she had him hired.

If the kidnapping happens, it could be where Cersei tells him what she wants him to do.

Thanks for the ask!

title: THAT screenshot 👀🤔
body:
Indeed, like many Sansa fans have been saying it does look like Sansa, Cersei & Qyburn 

I tried editing the video footage in FCP…..but the quality gets so distorted when you zoom in so much, but that definitely looks like red hair to me. Especially in the second picture when I sharpened the clip. 

I am torn on the potential kidnapping plot ….if it goes the way I want it to and many others have expressed they want it to go down, it could be amazing. 

I want my Sansa vs Cersei showdown, we have earned that.

blog.description: Fandom-frivolous and lazy fanfic writer. Also ballet bonkers and a leftist feminist. Will post on politics and lolz as well as Doctor Who, Potter, Star Wars and whatever else takes my fancy.

tags: I will not cower before the dragon
summary: On Sansa not cowering before the dragons
title: On Sansa not cowering before the dragons
body:
Well apart from there not being nearly enough Sansa in this trailer, can we talk about her seeing the dragons for the first time?! 

She doesn’t cower or flee, but walks after them in order to see more. 

Like, no other character apart from maybe Tyrion and Sam can have anticipated seeing them more than her? Everyone talks about how focused she is on the pretty songs, but she just loves stories and what bigger kick can a lover of tales get than literally seeing the most legendary creatures leap back into existence?

So disregarding all the strife that the dragons have the potential to represent, check her out being fucking fascinated, not terrified, of Dany’s babies.

summary: What do you mean when you said Sansa’s Lady persona = Arya’s No One? Do you think she will make her own spy network?
question: What do you mean when you said Sansa’s Lady persona = Arya’s No One? Do you think she will make her own spy network?
answer:
(Sorry for taking so long to reply to you, anon). 

Sansa and Arya have similar journey since Ned’s death. While both are displaced from their home and both desire to go back, they also are must survive the cruelty of their environment using the tools/ the identity that they know how to wear best. While Arya must let got of her nobility, of her femininity, and play the role of a simple “nobody,” of a dirty “boy,” Sansa accentuated her femaleness and made her Lady appearance her armor.

For example, this is Arya’s appearance in ACOK:

Arya looked down at her ragged clothes and bare feet, all cracked and callused. She saw the dirt uner her nails, the scabs on her elbows, the scratches on her hands. Septa Mordane wouldn’t even know me, I bet. Sansa might, but she’d pretend not to. “My mother’s a lady, and my sister, but I never was.” - Arya V 

This appearance allowed Arya to blend in, to be among her company, to hide herself from those who chase after her. She becomes a nobody, a ‘no one.’ The thing is, Arya didn’t just suddenly learn how to be “nobody.” She has always been like this. Not being lady-like, playing with ordinary folks, associating herself with people below her status. She always has a way to blend in with the commoners, so to speak. It’s her distinctive characteristic. And this characteristic became her advantage, it became her weapon. 

In contrast to Sansa,

“Knowing that Joffrey would require her to attend the tourney in his honor, Sansa had taken special care with her face and clothes. She wore a gown of pale purple sild and moonstone haire net that had been a gift from Joffrey. The gown had long sleeves to hide the bruises of her arms. Those were Joffrey’s gifts as well. When they told him that Robb had been proclaimed the King in the North, his rage had been fearsome thing and had sent Ser Boros to beat her.”

This is Sansa’s asset; it’s her distinctive characteristic. I think at this point of the story, Sansa is beginning to realize that in order for her to survive the court drama, she has to be convincing in her role as a docile lady. Not only she knows that this is what’s expected from her, but that there is a certain anonymity in normality, in passivity. If you don’t stand out, if you play the role expected from you, you may be able to find freedom to navigate through the court politics. As Arya finally realizes that shedding any trace of her nobility and femininity is her ticket to survival, Sansa also met a similar reckoning.

So Sansa plays her role:

The king settled back in his seat and took Sansa’s hand. Once that would have set her heart to pounding but that was before he had answered her plea for mercy by presenting her with her father’s head. His touch filled her with revulsion now, but she knew better than to show it. She made herself sit very still. 

“My father was a traitor,” Sansa said at once. “And my brother and lady mother are traitors as well.” That reflex she had learned quickly. “I am loyal to my beloved Joffrey.“ 

And lest we forget, she is doing this out of her own agency. As she kept repeating:

“Courtesy is a lady’s armor,” Sansa said. Her septa had always told her that. - Sansa III, ACOK

So, at the end of the day, while Arya is being groomed to be assassin, Sansa is also being groomed, or more importantly, is grooming herself to be a spy. 

Do I think Sansa will create her own spy network? No. I believe that was not the intention. I think as the tv show indicated, Arya’s particular strength complements Sansa’s own, and together they would be able to root out oppositions amongst their own people (like how they did Baelish). What I’m looking forward to is how this will play out in the books, how they will finally meet each other and realize that they will work wonders as tandem: as the Spy and the Assassin.

reblog.comment:
(Sorry for taking so long to reply to you, anon).

While Arya must let got of her nobility, of her femininity, and play the role of a simple “nobody,” of a dirty “boy,” Sansa accentuated her femaleness and made her Lady appearance her armor.

For example, this is Arya’s appearance in ACOK:

Arya looked down at her ragged clothes and bare feet, all cracked and callused. She saw the dirt uner her nails, the scabs on her elbows, the scratches on her hands. Septa Mordane wouldn’t even know me, I bet. Sansa might, but she’d pretend not to. “My mother’s a lady, and my sister, but I never was.” - Arya V 

This appearance allowed Arya to blend in, to be among her company, to hide herself from those who chase after her. She becomes a nobody, a ‘no one.’ The thing is, Arya didn’t just suddenly learn how to be “nobody.” She has always been like this. Not being lady-like, playing with ordinary folks, associating herself with people below her status. She always has a way to blend in with the commoners, so to speak. It’s her distinctive characteristic. And this characteristic became her advantage, it became her weapon. 

In contrast to Sansa,

“Knowing that Joffrey would require her to attend the tourney in his honor, Sansa had taken special care with her face and clothes. She wore a gown of pale purple sild and moonstone haire net that had been a gift from Joffrey. The gown had long sleeves to hide the bruises of her arms. Those were Joffrey’s gifts as well. When they told him that Robb had been proclaimed the King in the North, his rage had been fearsome thing and had sent Ser Boros to beat her.”

This is Sansa’s asset; it’s her distinctive characteristic. I think at this point of the story, Sansa is beginning to realize that in order for her to survive the court drama, she has to be convincing in her role as a docile lady. Not only she knows that this is what’s expected from her, but that there is a certain anonymity in normality, in passivity. If you don’t stand out, if you play the role expected from you, you may be able to find freedom to navigate through the court politics. As Arya finally realizes that shedding any trace of her nobility and femininity is her ticket to survival, Sansa also met a similar reckoning.

So Sansa plays her role:

The king settled back in his seat and took Sansa’s hand. Once that would have set her heart to pounding but that was before he had answered her plea for mercy by presenting her with her father’s head. His touch filled her with revulsion now, but she knew better than to show it. She made herself sit very still. 

“My father was a traitor,” Sansa said at once. “And my brother and lady mother are traitors as well.” That reflex she had learned quickly. “I am loyal to my beloved Joffrey.“ 

And lest we forget, she is doing this out of her own agency. As she kept repeating:

“Courtesy is a lady’s armor,” Sansa said. Her septa had always told her that. - Sansa III, ACOK

So, at the end of the day, while Arya is being groomed to be assassin, Sansa is also being groomed, or more importantly, is grooming herself to be a spy. 

Do I think Sansa will create her own spy network? No. I believe that was not the intention. I think as the tv show indicated, Arya’s particular strength complements Sansa’s own, and together they would be able to root out oppositions amongst their own people (like how they did Baelish). What I’m looking forward to is how this will play out in the books, how they will finally meet each other and realize that they will work wonders as tandem: as the Spy and the Assassin.
